notes: <all_urls> permission is not required to call this.
<all_urls> permission is not required to call this.

edge.notes: If the url has the 'ms-browser-extension://' protocol it is mistakenly considered a relative URL and the prefix is added redundantly, causing tab to fail loading.

firefox.notes: Before version 57, extensions were not allowed to open 'view-source:' pages.

firefox_android.notes: Before version 57, extensions were not allowed to open 'view-source:' pages.

notes: Will return und (undefined language) for OS lower than 11.
Locale identifier will include the country code more often.
Only accepts a single tab ID as a parameter, not an array.
The tab ID argument is optional: if it is omitted, the browser discards the least important tab.
The callback is passed a Tab object representing the tab that was discarded.
Tabs whose document contains a beforeunload listener that displays a prompt will be discarded.
Only accepts a single tab ID as a parameter, not an array.
The tab ID argument is optional: if it is omitted, the browser discards the least important tab.
The callback is passed a Tab object representing the tab that was discarded.
Tabs whose document contains a beforeunload listener that displays a prompt will be discarded.

chrome.notes: Extensions can't inject scripts into their own pages using this API.

firefox.notes: Before version 50, Firefox would pass a single result value into its callback rather than an array, unless 'allFrames' had been set.

opera.notes: Extensions can't inject scripts into their own pages using this API.

firefox.notes: 'allFrames' and 'frameId' can't both be set at the same time.

firefox_android.notes: 'allFrames' and 'frameId' can't both be set at the same time.

edge.notes: The panel, app, devtools and popup values for WindowType are not supported.

firefox.notes: Supports an array of strings to return tabs associated with any of the list of cookieStoreIds.

firefox_android.notes: Treated as an alias for queryInfo.active except when an extension has a popup open. In this situation, queryInfo.highlighted will return the popup, while queryInfo.active will return the tab that was selected before the popup opened.

notes: Fails if the extension doesn't have the tabs permission.
Before Firefox 56, moz-extension:// URLs were not allowed.
Fails if the extension doesn't have the tabs permission.
Before Firefox 56, moz-extension:// URLs were not allowed.

firefox.notes: This function does not work on macOS.

edge.notes: No response is sent after the receiving tab is refreshed if there is no runtime.onMessage listener.
